item.title: From Intigriti challenge to a Vue.js script gadget
item.author: Author
item.description: Intigiriti’s November challenge by IvarsVids was about a Vue.js one-pager that reflected user input with some replacements. After visiting the challenge homepage at https://challenge-1121.intigriti.io/ we quickly notice it reflects s query parameter not escaping HTML less than and greater than signs resulting in HTML injection.

item.title: Intigriti's February XSS Challenge Writeup
item.author: Author
item.description: This month’s challenge, made by Holme, was a little bit different than the ones I have previously solved as it had a server-side processing issue.

item.title: Intigriti's December XSS Challenge Writeup
item.author: Author
item.description: This month’s Intigriti’s XSS challenge was interesting as a couple of hours after Frans Rosén submitted an unintended solution, and I got interested in that one more than in the original.
